message.content:
{"id": "5340", 
 "title": "Bug 5340 - Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect", 
 "description": "When cancelling the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the action has no effect and the breakpoint is still added. To reproduce the issue: ", 
 "OB": "1) Open the debug perspective and go to the breakpoints pane. \n2) Click the '+' button to add an exception breakpoint. \n3) In the progress dialog that appears, click the 'Cancel' button. ", 
 "EB": "After clicking the 'Cancel' button in the progress dialog, the exception breakpoint should not be added and should not appear in the breakpoints pane. ", 
 "SR": "Ensure that cancelling the process of adding an exception breakpoint successfully prevents the breakpoint from being added."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '5340', 'title': 'Bug 5340Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': '1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective2) Click the J! button to add an exception3) In the progress dialog, click cancel. '}
